comment: Colour Hue and Saturation adapted to DTDL from smartdatamodels.org. Source: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/smart-data-models/dataModel.OCF/master/ColourHS/schema.json
description: Smart Data Models Program adaptation of the original IoTData data Models. This Resource describes the colour using hue-saturation conventions. The Property 'hue' is the hue angle, it is a number value as defined by the CIECAM02 model definition (see reference [CIE CIE159:2004]). A Device that does not support fractional hue angles can provide integer values. If Property 'precision' is provided it applies to the hue angle. The Property 'saturation' is an integer value as defined by the CIECAM02 model definit

contents.name: alternateName
contents.comment: An alternative name for this item

contents.name: areaServed
contents.comment: The geographic area where a service or offered item is provided

contents.name: dataProvider
contents.comment: A sequence of characters identifying the provider of the harmonised data entity

contents.name: dateCreated
contents.comment: Entity creation timestamp. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform

contents.name: dateModified
contents.comment: Timestamp of the last modification of the entity. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform

contents.name: hue
contents.comment: The hue angle as defined by the CIECAM02 model definition.

contents.name: maximumsaturation
contents.comment: The maximum supported value of 'saturation' for this Device.

contents.name: precision
contents.comment: When exposed the value in 'precision' provides a +/- tolerance against the Properties in the Resource. Thus if a Property is UPDATED to a value and that Property then RETRIEVED, the RETRIEVED value is valid if in the range of the set value +/- precision

contents.name: saturation
contents.comment: The saturation as defined by the CIECAM02 model definition.

contents.name: source
contents.comment: A sequence of characters giving the original source of the entity data as a URL. Recommended to be the fully qualified domain name of the source provider, or the URL to the source object

contents.name: if
contents.comment: The OCF Interface set supported by this Resource.

contents.name: owner
contents.comment: A List containing a JSON encoded sequence of characters referencing the unique Ids of the owner(s)
